Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or credible sources to support the statement that Hillary Clinton made the quoted remark.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the quote attributed to Hillary Clinton is accurate and true, without providing any substantial proof.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the quote attributed to Clinton is a fabrication or misattribution, as it has been debunked by fact-checking websites like Snopes.com.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the alleged quote has been debunked by fact-checkers.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of the alleged quote by using strong language to describe Democrat voters as "stupid" and "easy to manipulate."
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on a tweet from a controversial figure, David A. Clarke Jr., as the primary source of the alleged quote.
